sentences: Richard Aaron Katz (March 13, 1924 – November 10, 2009) was an American jazz pianist, arranger and record producer.
He co-founded Milestone Records in 1966 with Orrin Keepnews.
In the 1950s, he joined the house rhythm section of the Café Bohemia, and worked in the groups of Ben Webster and Kenny Dorham, Oscar Pettiford, and, later, Carmen McRae.
From 1954 to 1955, he was part of the J. J. Johnson/Kai Winding Quintet.
In the late 1960s, he played with Roy Eldridge and Lee Konitz.
In the 1990s, he worked as a pianist and arranger with the American Jazz Orchestra and Loren Schoenberg's big band.
